result.execSummary:
The defendant Robbin M. Stanton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting >$2500-$5000, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Taylor County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Restitution shall be paid at the rate of at least $150.00 a month.
Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample.

Defendant shall write a letter of apology to the victims due within 30 days after plea and sentencing and to be preapproved by probation.  Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.  Defendant shall obtain/maintain full time employment at the discretion of probation.    Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections.  If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

timeConds.notes:
Defendant must serve 5 days jail  to begin no later than March 2, 2016 at 4:30 pm.  The remaining 15 days are stayed and are to be imposed at agent's discretion if defendant fails to pay restitution payments of $150.00 a month.  

The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: DOC Face Sheet Intake and Investigation
In Court Notice to Defendant After Sentencing
Restitution Summary

Defendant Robbin M. Stanton in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Victim rights complied - victims are in court.  Plea of no contest.  Plea colloquy.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Statement by attorneys regarding jail sentence. No statement by victims.   Court finds defendant guilty and orders withheld sentence probation for 3 years with conditions; court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; letter of apology to the victim due within 30 days after plea and sentencing preapproved by probation; counseling as deemed appropriate by probation; restitution in the amount of $6,000.00 to be paid at the rate of $150.00 per month; restitution surcharge; obtain/maintain full time employment at the discretion of probation; court orders 20 days county jail with 5 days to be served immediately with the remaining 15 days stayed and imposed at agent's discretion if defendant does not make restitution payments.
